string.text:
This cartridge made for the VKS bullpup can carry a projectile weighing between 59g and 76g, yielding massive amounts of kinetic energy.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR6 (75)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]73

The .45 calibre full metal jacket round has enjoyed popularity for a hundred years thanks to its ballistic performance and a relatively small propelling charge. As a result, the bullet in this round is relatively slow but highly accurate and provides considerable stopping power.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR2 (20)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]27

This unusual .45 ACP round consists of a jacketed soft point bullet with a hollow steel core, possessing both their advantages and disadvantages.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR1 (10)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]69

This cartridge made for the VKS bullpup can carry a projectile weighing between 59g and 76g, yielding massive amounts of kinetic energy.
 
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR4 (38)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]73

Standard 12 gauge shell filled with 8mm shot. Highly lethal at close range. Only suitable for use with smoothbore weapons.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]None (3 x 9)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]190 (21 x 9)
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]UNIQUE: %c[0,250,250,0]expanding cloud of pellets w/ short eff. range

12 gauge dart round, normally used for hunting big game but also suitable for other purposes, including puncturing armour.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR4 (42)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]74

12 gauge custom-made slugs for putting down big mutants. Slug is made of copper-covered lead, housing dart-like inserts made of steel. Slug is very long and has a very large powder load.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR2
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]very high

This heavy 12 gauge slug round is normally used for hunting big game, but is also good for other purposes. Instead of piercing, this hefty slug simply crushes through armour.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR2 (23)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]132

A specialised rimless bottlenecked centrefire cartridge developed for military long-range sniper rifles. The .338 Lapua is a dual-purpose anti-personnel and anti-materiel round, though its anti-materiel potential is limited.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]Unlimited (140)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]130

A hollow-point bullet with the purpose of slowing down upon impact, decreasing its penetration but inversely causing larger internal tissue damage.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR1 (15)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG):: %c[ui_gray_2]103

Military calibre 7N22 armour-piercing round for automatic rifles of Warsaw Pact countries. The bullet contains a hard-alloy armour-piercing penetrator and is effective against body armour.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR5 (47)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]36

Military calibre HP hollow point round for automatic rifles of Warsaw Pact countries.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR1 (15)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]53

Military calibre 7N6 standard issue round for automatic rifles of Warsaw Pact countries. Provides better accuracy than the 7.62 calibre round thanks to reduced recoil and a 100-metre increase in range.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR2 (27)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]38

The latest NATO military calibre enhanced penetration round, known as the M855A1, used by the US armed forces. Increased effectiveness against both body armour and soft tissue.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR5 (52)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]35

A standard-issue NATO calibre round with a hollow point tip.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR1 (15)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]46

A standard-issue NATO calibre M193 round specially designed for accurate automatic fire. Provides good ballistic characteristics, having been designed on the basis of a hunting round. Known for having great performance against tissue, but limited penetration.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR3 (27)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]35

A high velocity cartridge designed and manufactured by FN Herstal, developed in conjunction with the FN P90 personal defense weapon (PDW) and FN Five-seven pistol, in response to NATO requests for a replacement for the 9x19mm Parabellum cartridge.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR4 (38)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]23

The HK 4.6x30mm cartridge is a type of ammunition primarily used in the Heckler & Koch MP7 personal defense weapon (PDW), designed to minimize weight and recoil while increasing penetration of body armor.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR3
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]low to medium

An expansive, bottlenecked centrefire cartridge designed and manufactured by FN Herstal, somewhat similar to the .22 Hornet or .22 K-Hornet.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR2 (22)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]23

A cartridge developed for the Browning .50 caliber machine gun, it is a standard cartridge for NATO forces as well as many non-NATO countries. The cartridge is often used in long-range target and anti-materiel rifles, as well as other .50-caliber machine guns.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR6
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]very high

A Russian bottle-necked pistol cartridge widely used in former Soviet satellite states, China and Pakistan. It is intended for sport shooting and hunting. By design, this cartridge provides considerable stopping power though it lacks in penetrative capabilities, even against basic ballistic protection.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]None (8)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]30

A steel cored Russian bottle-necked pistol cartridge widely used in former Soviet satellite states, China and Pakistan. It's very effective against medium-armored targets.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR2 (24)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]21

An armour piercing round produced in China, often referred to as "7.62x39 CN". This round features a mild steel core which enhances its penetration capabilities.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR5 (55)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]40

A rimless bottlenecked intermediate cartridge of Soviet origin. It is widely used due to the worldwide proliferation of Russian SKS and AK-47 pattern rifles, as well as RPD and RPK light machine guns. FMJ is one of the most commonly used types of ammunition due to the sheer power and penetrative capabilities of the round.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR3 (30)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]40

Military calibre M61 armor-piercing round with a hardened steel core. It retains high damage while greatly improving performance against body armor.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR6 (62)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]59

A military variant of the .308 round which was standard-issue by the NATO forces until 5.56 ammunition was introduced in the '70s in the Vietnam War. At present, it is most commonly employed by private military contractors all over the world and is still quite common.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR3 (34)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]59

An armour-piercing cartridge with a steel core for penetrating body armour or light barriers and a boat-tail base to increase accuracy.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR4 (45)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]62

A sniper round with a steel penetrator specially designed for the SVD. It's steel core is made to pierce light armors.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR3 (30)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]62

A high-powered armor-piercing machine gun round with a hard steel core, allowing it to possess good penetrative capabilities.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR6 (80)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]62

A dated rifle calibre introduced in the Soviet Empire at the turn of the 19th century. Originally designed for the Mosin-Nagant standard-issue infantry rifle. Relatively cheap but has surprisingly good penetrative capabilities, even in comparison to more modern ammo types.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR3 (37)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]62

A round that was used by the British military against armoured targets. It features a hardened steel core, giving it higher piercing capabilities. Used primarily for long range shots, the grain quality of this round is higher than the standard.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR4 (39)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]69

This Mauser round was adopted by the German Empire and then the Third Reich. It was one of the most popular cartridges in the period of two world wars. However, now the round is primarily used for hunting and sport.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR3 (27)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]69

The RG028 is a cartridge used for its armour penetration capabilities with the original goal of being a counter to body armour. Unfortunately, the round only provides a slightly stronger impact than that of a typical 9x18 round.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR3 (27)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]18

A full metal jacket round with a steel penetrator and a lead core under a metal jacket. Provides good stopping power but is ineffective against body armour.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR1 (15)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]18

This round contains a bullet with enhanced stopping power thanks to its hollow point. Ineffective against body armour, but high damage against flesh.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]none (10)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]33

A Russian calibre bullet with a hard steel core and increased pressure. Designed to enhance armour penetrating capabilities of small arms and submachine guns.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR3 (34)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]21

Basic calibre round with a jacketed bullet. Ineffective against body armour.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR1 (17)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]21

Jacketed hollow-point bullet with high stopping power and low ricochet propensity. Used by police and for self-defense. Ineffective against body armour due to its low penetration potential.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]none (10)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]40

The SP-6 is a subsonic armour-piercing round with a hard steel core that protrudes from the casing. Requires a suppressor for stealth firing. Used by special services of Warsaw Pact countries and is effective against light body armour.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR5 (55)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]43
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]UNIQUE: %c[0,250,250,0]sub-sonic ammunition, greatly increased projectile drop with distance

A subsonic rifle round with a bimetallic casing, containing a steel core with a gap behind it that is filled with lead. Requires a suppressor for stealth firing. Used by special services of Warsaw Pact countries.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]BR3 (34)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]43
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]UNIQUE: %c[0,250,250,0]sub-sonic ammunition, greatly increased projectile drop with distance

Batteries that use a capsulated fragment of the "Flash" artefact as their power source. Manufactured using hi-tech equipment.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]REDACTED
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]REDACTED
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]UNIQUE: %c[0,250,250,0]technological item, prototype

These lower-capacity cells use capsulated fragments of the "Flash" artefact as their power source. Their lower capacity is due to makeshift production conditions and lack of specialised equipment.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]REDACTED
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]REDACTED
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]UNIQUE: %c[0,250,250,0]technological item, prototype

40mm grenade for the M203 underbarrel grenade launcher with a 3.5 metre kill zone.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Blast power: %c[ui_gray_2]medium
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Blast radius: %c[ui_gray_2]4.1 m
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Fragment radius: %c[ui_gray_2]28 m
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Av. number of fragments: %c[ui_gray_2]95 (small shrapnel)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Explosion delay: %c[ui_gray_2]none (explodes on impact)

Fragmentation warhead for anti-personnel warfare used with the RPG-7 grenade launcher with the main purpose of killing enemies in cover that are outside the range of hand grenades.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Blast power: %c[ui_gray_2]high
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Blast radius: %c[ui_gray_2]5.6 m
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Fragment radius: %c[ui_gray_2]41 m
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Av. number of fragments: %c[ui_gray_2]153 (small shrapnel)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Explosion delay: %c[ui_gray_2]none (explodes on impact)

Regular fragmentation grenade for the GP-25 Kostyor underbarrel grenade launcher with a 2.5 metre kill zone.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Blast power: %c[ui_gray_2]medium
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Blast radius: %c[ui_gray_2]3.6 m
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Fragment radius: %c[ui_gray_2]20 m
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Av. number of fragments: %c[ui_gray_2]81 (small shrapnel)
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Explosion delay: %c[ui_gray_2]none (explodes on impact)

Home-made 12 gauge shell filled with small pieces of metal junk, including used or damaged bullets or shrapnel. Highly lethal at close range. Only suitable for use with smoothbore weapons.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]none
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]medium to high
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]UNIQUE: %c[0,250,250,0]expanding cloud of pellets, short eff. range
Boiled animal fat, diesel and bits of melted rubber. Makes for a sticky, napalm-like substance when lit.
Cartridge with buckshot charge used for firing from the KS-23 carbine. Application range of up to 25 meters.
A cartridge with a steel pointed bullet used for firing from the KS-23 carbine to forcibly stop vehicles by sheer damaging. Application range of up to 100 meters.
Pistol cartridge with a heat-strengthened steel core, allowing the round to posess highly penetrative properties.

Standard 20-calibre round filled with 6mm buckshot. Highly lethal at close range. Only suitable for use with smoothbore weapons.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]none
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]medium to high
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]UNIQUE: %c[0,250,250,0]expanding cloud of pellets, short eff. range

A special cartridge designed for the needs of the scientific staff located in the Zone. Depending on the task, it is filled with different types of solutions. Requires very careful handling.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Armor penetration power (AP): %c[ui_gray_2]none
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Nominal stopping power (DMG): %c[ui_gray_2]none
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]UNIQUE: %c[0,250,250,0]pierces the skin of mutants to inject solutions
